summary:
- This code defines a GroupBy class for handling group-by operations on a DataFrame.
- The constructor takes a DataFrame object (df), grouping columns (by), a flag to maintain order (maintain_order), and optional named grouping columns (named_by).
- It validates the grouping columns: if a single column is provided, it is stored directly; if multiple columns are provided, it checks if they are strings and exist in the DataFrame's columns, then creates a query compiler for the selected columns; otherwise, it checks whether the provided columns are of the same type as the original query compiler.
- If the validation fails, it raises a NotImplementedError.
- The class is designed to support a ****.

It handles grouping columns: if one column, assign directly; else if all strings and exist in df columns, set self.by to query compiler of those columns; else if all are same type as df._query_compiler, assign directly; else raise NotImplementedError. Also stores named_by and maintain_order.

The code also defines apply = map_groups (maybe alias). But not needed.
